abstract: New York State legislators approve law allowing teachers and administrators to discuss certain standardized test questions, but only those publicly released by state; educators had been barred from discussing questions by signing confidentiality agreements.
lead_paragraph: Teachers who grade standardized tests, who are required to sign confidentiality agreements, can now discuss some test materials once they’ve been released by the state.

headline.main: State Relaxes an Order Preventing Teachers From Discussing Standardized Tests
headline.print_headline: State Relaxes an Order Preventing Teachers From Discussing Standardized Tests

snippet: Teachers who grade standardized tests, who are required to sign confidentiality agreements, can now discuss some test materials once they’ve been released by the state.
